definitions: carrying or equipped with weapons, especially guns or other military equipment
having natural defensive or protective structures such as thorns or spines
examples: The armed guards protected the embassy throughout the night
Armed forces surrounded the building during the crisis
The armed cactus species evolved to deter desert predators
Armed with sharp thorns, the rose bush grew wild

definitions: covered with protective metal plating or armor for defense against attack
having a strong protective covering or shell in nature or design
examples: The armored vehicle moved slowly through the combat zone
Armored knights dominated medieval battlefields for centuries
The armored beetle's shell protects it from predators
They installed armored glass in the bank windows

definitions: having a pleasant and distinctive smell, especially from spices or herbs
relating to or containing chemical compounds with benzene rings in chemistry
examples: The aromatic spices filled the kitchen with wonderful scents
She added aromatic herbs to enhance the dish
Aromatic hydrocarbons are important compounds in organic chemistry
The aromatic ring structure gives these molecules unique properties

definitions: brought to a state of emotional excitement or heightened awareness
experiencing sexual excitement or stimulation
awakened from sleep or brought from inactivity to action
examples: The aroused crowd cheered wildly for their team
She felt aroused by the passionate speech
The aroused couple embraced in the darkness
He became aroused by her intimate touch
The aroused bear emerged from its winter den
The aroused citizens demanded immediate action

definitions: organized or placed in a particular order or pattern systematically
planned or agreed upon beforehand, especially regarding marriages or meetings
examples: The arranged flowers created a stunning centerpiece display
Books were arranged alphabetically on the library shelves
Their arranged marriage turned into a loving partnership
The arranged meeting took place at noon

definitions: displayed or arranged in an impressive or ordered manner
dressed in elaborate or impressive clothing or decoration
examples: The arrayed soldiers stood in perfect formation
Products were arrayed on shelves for maximum appeal
The bride was arrayed in silk and diamonds
Knights arrayed in shining armor entered the hall

definitions: striking or impressive enough to capture and hold attention immediately
having the effect of stopping or checking progress or movement
examples: Her arresting beauty stopped everyone in their tracks
The painting's arresting colors dominated the gallery wall
The arresting force of the evidence halted the trial
His arresting grip prevented her from falling

definitions: having an exaggerated sense of one's own importance or abilities, showing contempt for others
examples: His arrogant attitude alienated his coworkers
The arrogant executive refused to listen to suggestions

definitions: relating to or affecting the arteries that carry blood from the heart
serving as a main route or channel for traffic or distribution
examples: The arterial blood pressure was dangerously high
Arterial disease can lead to serious health problems
The arterial road connects major cities across the region
This arterial pipeline supplies oil to three states

definitions: showing creative skill or taste in design or execution
clever or cunning in achieving a purpose through deceit or evasion
examples: Her artful arrangement of flowers won first prize
The photographer's artful composition captured the scene perfectly
His artful dodging of questions frustrated the investigators
She used artful persuasion to get her way

definitions: expressed clearly and effectively in speech or writing
having the ability to speak fluently and express thoughts coherently
examples: She gave an articulate presentation of her research findings
His articulate response impressed the interview panel
The articulate speaker captivated the audience for hours
Even young children can be surprisingly articulate

definitions: having joints or segments that allow movement between parts
expressed clearly and distinctly in words or sounds
examples: The articulated bus could navigate tight city corners
An articulated skeleton helps students understand bone connections
She articulated her concerns clearly to the committee
The articulated plan outlined every step in detail

definitions: made or produced by human beings rather than occurring naturally
lacking in naturalness or spontaneity; forced or contrived in manner
examples: The artificial sweetener has fewer calories than sugar
Scientists created artificial diamonds in the laboratory
Her artificial smile didn't fool anyone at the party
The conversation felt artificial and uncomfortable

definitions: relating to or characteristic of art or artists
having or showing natural creative skill and imagination
examples: The artistic community gathered for the gallery opening
She pursued artistic studies at the university
His artistic arrangement of food impressed the dinner guests
The child showed artistic talent from an early age

definitions: rising in power, influence, or importance; moving upward
having dominant power or influence over others or situations
examples: The ascendant political party gained more seats
Her ascendant career trajectory impressed everyone
The ascendant culture shaped regional development for centuries
His ascendant position in the company was undeniable

definitions: moving or going upward; rising toward a higher level or position
arranged in order from smallest to largest or lowest to highest
examples: The ascending balloon disappeared into the clouds
We watched the ascending smoke from the campfire
Sort the numbers in ascending order from one to ten
The ascending scale of musical notes sounded perfect

definitions: found out or learned with certainty through investigation or evidence
examples: The ascertained facts changed the course of the investigation
Once ascertained, the truth could not be denied

definitions: characterized by severe self-discipline and abstention from indulgence
having a simple and austere appearance without decoration or comfort
examples: The monk lived an ascetic life in the mountain monastery
His ascetic practices included fasting and meditation
The ascetic room contained only a bed and desk
Her ascetic appearance reflected her minimalist philosophy

definitions: without sexual feelings or associations; not interested in sexual relationships
relating to reproduction without fusion of gametes or sexual processes
examples: Some people identify as asexual and form deep platonic bonds
The asexual character challenged traditional romantic narratives
Many plants can reproduce through asexual propagation methods
Asexual reproduction produces genetically identical offspring

definitions: feeling embarrassed, guilty, or disgraced about one's actions or circumstances
examples: She felt ashamed of her earlier outburst at work
He was too ashamed to admit his mistake

definitions: having a pale grayish color like ash, often unhealthy looking
covered with or containing ash from burned material
examples: His ashy complexion worried the doctor during examination
The ashy sky threatened more snow
The ashy ground showed where the campfire had been
Ashy residue covered everything after the volcanic eruption

definitions: not in a straight or level position; tilted to one side
examples: The picture frame hung askew after the earthquake
His tie was askew after the windy walk

definitions: in the state of sleep; not awake or conscious
lacking sensation due to restricted blood flow, typically in limbs
examples: The baby fell asleep in her mother's arms
He was still asleep when the alarm rang
My foot fell asleep during the long meeting
Her arm was asleep from lying on it

definitions: having ambitions to achieve something, typically a position or status
examples: The aspirant politician campaigned tirelessly for months
Aspirant writers submitted their manuscripts to publishers

definitions: directing one's hopes or ambitions toward becoming a specified type of person
examples: The aspiring actor moved to Hollywood for opportunities
Many aspiring chefs attend culinary school

definitions: killed suddenly and deliberately, especially an important person for political reasons
examples: The assassinated president became a martyr for the cause
Several assassinated leaders changed the course of history

definitions: stated or declared confidently and forcefully as fact or belief
examples: Her asserted claim was later proven to be true
The asserted rights became the basis for legal action

definitions: having or showing confident and forceful personality or behavior
examples: Her assertive manner helped her succeed in negotiations
The assertive student always participated in class discussions

definitions: designated or selected for a specific task or duty
allocated to a particular place, position, or purpose
examples: The assigned homework must be completed by Friday
Each student worked on their assigned project
Please sit in your assigned seat for the flight
The assigned parking spaces are clearly marked

definitions: absorbing and integrating ideas, knowledge, or culture into a wider system
examples: The assimilating process helped immigrants adapt to new customs
Students are assimilating complex information during the lecture

definitions: serving in a subordinate position to help or support someone
examples: The assistant manager handled customer complaints efficiently
She works as an assistant professor at the university

definitions: helped or supported by someone or something in performing an action
examples: The assisted living facility provides care for elderly residents
Computer-assisted design revolutionized architectural planning

definitions: designed to help or assist, especially for people with disabilities
examples: Assistive technology helps students with learning disabilities succeed
The assistive devices improved her mobility significantly

definitions: having a subordinate or junior position in an organization
connected or joined with something else in a relationship
examples: The associate editor reviewed all submitted manuscripts
She started as an associate member of the club
Associate symptoms may indicate a more serious condition
The associate company shares our business values

definitions: relating to or involving the mental connection between thoughts, ideas, or memories
examples: Associative memory helps us recall related information quickly
The associative property applies to addition and multiplication

definitions: consisting of various different types mixed together or collected
examples: The box contained assorted chocolates from around the world
Assorted vegetables were arranged on the platter

definitions: accepted as true without proof; taken for granted
adopted or taken on, especially as a false identity or role
examples: The assumed connection between events proved to be false
Her assumed innocence was questioned by investigators
He traveled under an assumed name to avoid detection
The spy's assumed identity fooled everyone

definitions: taking something for granted without proof or evidence
showing arrogant presumption or taking liberties without permission
examples: Assuming good weather, we'll have the picnic outdoors
The assuming nature of his hypothesis needed verification
His assuming attitude annoyed everyone at the meeting
Don't be so assuming about what others want

definitions: guaranteed to happen or be achieved; certain and reliable
showing confidence and self-possession in one's behavior or manner
examples: Victory seemed assured after their strong performance
Your assured place in history is already secured
Her assured manner impressed the interview panel
He spoke with an assured tone despite the pressure

definitions: giving confidence or removing doubt through positive declaration or guarantee
examples: Her assuring words calmed the frightened children
The doctor's assuring tone helped reduce patient anxiety

definitions: affected by asthma, a respiratory condition causing breathing difficulty
characterized by wheezing or labored breathing sounds
examples: The asthmatic child always carried an inhaler
Asthmatic patients need regular medical monitoring
His asthmatic breathing worried the coach during practice
The old engine made asthmatic noises when starting

definitions: filled with sudden wonder or amazement; extremely surprised
examples: She was astonished by the unexpected marriage proposal
The astonished audience gasped at the magician's trick

definitions: causing great surprise or wonder; amazing and unexpected
examples: The athlete's astonishing performance broke three world records
She made astonishing progress in just six months

definitions: shocked or greatly surprised, often to the point of being unable to react
examples: He was astounded when he won the lottery
The astounded scientists couldn't believe their discovery

definitions: surprisingly impressive or notable; causing shock through being remarkable
examples: The company reported astounding profits this quarter
Her astounding memory allowed her to recall every detail

definitions: relating to or resembling the stars in the sky
relating to a supposed spiritual realm or non-physical existence
examples: Ancient sailors used astral navigation to cross oceans
The astral phenomena fascinated the astronomers
She claimed to experience astral projection during meditation
The mystic spoke of astral planes beyond physical reality

definitions: causing the contraction of body tissues, typically used in medicine
sharp and penetrating in taste or smell; severely critical
examples: The astringent lotion helped reduce oily skin
Witch hazel is a natural astringent substance
Her astringent wit often offended sensitive people
The wine had an astringent taste that puckered the mouth

definitions: relating to astrology and the supposed influence of celestial bodies on human affairs
examples: She consulted her astrological chart before making decisions
The astrological predictions appeared in the daily newspaper

definitions: relating to astronomy or the scientific study of celestial objects
extremely large in amount or scale; enormous beyond normal comprehension
examples: The astronomical observations revealed a new planet
She studied astronomical phenomena at the observatory
The astronomical cost of healthcare shocked many families
Property prices have reached astronomical levels

definitions: having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations and turn them to advantage
examples: The astute investor recognized the opportunity before others
Her astute observations helped solve the complex case
